## Get Subnet UUID, use that to get Cluster UUID, then get VIP
# Set the JWT, headers and payload
jwt     = '@@{calm_jwt}@@'
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json', 'Authorization': 'Bearer {}'.format(jwt)}
payload = {}

# Set the address for Subnet call
url = "https://localhost:9440/api/nutanix/v3/subnets/@@{platform.status.resources.nic_list[0].subnet_reference.uuid}@@"

# Make the Subnets GET Call
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the Subnets call went through successfully
if resp.ok:
  spec = json.loads(resp.content)['spec']
  cluster_uuid = spec['cluster_reference']['uuid']
  print "NETWORK_NAME=" + spec['name']
  print "NETWORK_VLAN=" + str(spec['resources']['vlan_id'])

# If the Subnets call failed
else:
  print "Subnets call failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

# Set the address for Clusters call
url = "https://localhost:9440/api/nutanix/v3/clusters/{0}".format(cluster_uuid)

# Make the Clusters GET Call
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the Clusters call went through successfully
if resp.ok:
  print "PE_VIP={0}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['spec']['resources']['network']['external_ip'])

# If the Subnets call failed
else:
  print "Clusters call failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

exit(0)

# Set creds and headers
pe_user = '@@{pe_creds.username}@@'
pe_pass = '@@{pe_creds.secret}@@'
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Set the address for Ctr call
url = "https://@@{PE_VIP}@@:9440/PrismGateway/services/rest/v2.0/storage_containers/?search_string=default-container"

# Make the Ctr GET Call
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=pe_user, passwd=pe_pass,
              headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the Ctr call went through successfully
if resp.ok:

  entity = json.loads(resp.content)['entities'][0]
  print "CTR_UUID=" + entity['storage_container_uuid']
  print "CTR_NAME=" + entity['name']

# If the Ctr call failed
else:
  print "Subnets call failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

# Set the address for cluster call
url = "https://@@{PE_VIP}@@:9440/PrismGateway/services/rest/v2.0/cluster/"

# Make the Ctr GET Call
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=pe_user, passwd=pe_pass,
              headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the Cluster call went through successfully
if resp.ok:

  entity = json.loads(resp.content)
  print "CLSTR_NAME=" + entity['name']

# If the Cluster call failed
else:
  print "Cluster call failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Generate the Postgres Network File
cat << EOF > ~/postgres_network.txt
{
  "type": "Network", 
  "dbVersion": "ALL", 
  "engineType": "postgres_database", 
  "properties": [
    {
      "name": "@@{NETWORK_NAME}@@", 
      "value": "@@{NETWORK_VLAN}@@", 
      "description": "@@{NETWORK_NAME}@@ VLAN"
    }
  ], 
  "topology": "ALL"
}
EOF

# Generate the Postgres Network File
cat << EOF > ~/mariadb_network.txt
{
  "type": "Network", 
  "dbVersion": "ALL", 
  "engineType": "mariadb_database", 
  "properties": [
    {
      "name": "@@{NETWORK_NAME}@@", 
      "value": "@@{NETWORK_VLAN}@@", 
      "description": "@@{NETWORK_NAME}@@ VLAN"
    }
  ], 
  "topology": "ALL"
}
EOF

# Create the network profiles
era -c "profile network create name=DEFAULT_POSTGRES_NETWORK input_file=postgres_network.txt publish=true"
era -c "profile network create name=DEFAULT_MARIADB_NETWORK input_file=mariadb_network.txt publish=true"
